title.value: The « jingle-jangle fallacy » of empathy: Delineating affective, cognitive and motor components of empathy from behavioral synchrony using a virtual agent
title.justification: The paper's title clearly indicates its focus on distinguishing different components of empathy using a virtual agent.
title.quote: The « jingle-jangle fallacy » of empathy: Delineating affective, cognitive and motor components of empathy from behavioral synchrony using a virtual agent

extractions.description: The paper explores the various facets of empathy, including affective, cognitive, and motor components, and their association with behavioral synchrony using a virtual agent. It employs Confirmatory Factor Analyses to investigate these constructs and their role in non-verbal interactions.

type.justification: The study involves empirical analysis through the use of Confirmatory Factor Analyses and synchronization tasks with participants.
type.quote: The present investigation delineated relationships between empathy facets, using questionnaires and a motor task measuring synchrony, a non-verbal component of social interactions.

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on studying interactions between humans and virtual agents, fitting well within the domain of Human-Computer Interaction.
name.quote: ...testing their association with a synchronization task using a virtual agent.

name.justification: The study investigates psychological constructs such as empathy and synchrony, placing it within the field of psychology.
name.quote: Empathy is a multidimensional construct, incorporating affective and cognitive components...

name.justification: The study's exploration of synchrony and empathy in social interactions aligns with social computing, particularly in non-verbal interactions using a virtual agent.
name.quote: These findings support a convergence of empathy and synchrony research fields to better understand their respective contribution in non-verbal social interactions.

name.justification: The study utilizes a dynamical model to drive the virtual agent used in the synchronization task, indicating its use in the research.
name.quote: A subsample (N = 202) executed synchronous movement with a virtual agent driven by a dynamical model of behavioral synchrony.

is_contributed.justification: The model is applied in the study but not claimed as a novel contribution by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: A subsample (N = 202) executed synchronous movement with a virtual agent driven by a dynamical model of behavioral synchrony.

is_executed.justification: The model is executed during the synchronization task with the virtual agent.
is_executed.quote: A subsample (N = 202) executed synchronous movement with a virtual agent driven by a dynamical model of behavioral synchrony.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance or outcomes are not compared against other models in the study.
is_compared.quote: There is no mention of a comparison with other models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for the dynamical model of behavioral synchrony is not included in the provided section of the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A subsample (N = 202) executed synchronous movement with a virtual agent driven by a dynamical model of behavioral synchrony.
